alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Douglas; Grant (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 10:41PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central and North Central Washington, including the following counties, in Central Washington, Grant, Chelan and Douglas. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways or urban areas will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1035 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ephrata, Quincy, Rock Island, Lakeview, Soap Lake, Palisades, Winchester, Alstown and Laveview Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
